metadata.title: CVE-2022-38477 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developer Nika Layzell and the Mozilla Fuzzing Team reported memorysafety bugs present in Firefox 103 and Firefox ESR 102.1. Some of thesebugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enougheffort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.2, Thunderbird < 102.2, and Firefox< 104.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-38477` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
